node.title: Their Second Date Couldâ€™ve Been Their Last
node.alt: Andrew Shoulders, left, and Charles Reese II.
node.description: Andrew Shoulders credits the good listening skills of Charles Reese II to salvaging an early date, and their relationship.
node.content: ["The incipient relationship of Andrew Shoulders and Charles Reese II might have reached an unfortunate end on just their second date had it not been for Mr. Reese\u2019s well-developed listening skills.", "\u201cHe really pays attention to what people say,\u201d Mr. Shoulders, 40, said.", "For their first date, in November 2010, the men met at a wine bar in New York. Three bottles of wine were consumed and the two, both gregarious anyway, chatted for hours. Their second date, a dinner, took place later that month. But when it was interrupted by a call from a friend to Mr. Reese, who is 45 and known as Corey, and he abruptly announced that he had to go, their future suddenly looked bleak.", "\u201cThe debacle,\u201d Mr. Shoulders said, remembering the event. \u201cI was checking my breath, checking my hair, wondering what the hell happened.\u201d", "Mr. Reese didn\u2019t want to leave Mr. Shoulders with the wrong impression, so when he was done helping his friend, he tracked down Mr. Shoulders, showing up at a birthday party that Mr. Shoulders had told Mr. Reese he\u2019d be attending after their dinner together.", "\u201cHe circled back to where he\u2019d heard me say I\u2019d be \u2014 very smart guy,\u201d Mr. Shoulders said.", "The two had originally connected on a gay dating website, Connexion, after Mr. Reese sent Mr. Shoulders a note saying he thought it was great that Mr. Shoulders had included a picture of himself with his mother. (Mr. Shoulders said he felt it was important to say in his profile, \u201cListen guys, I\u2019m a big momma\u2019s boy.\u201d)", "Of his initial impression of Mr. Shoulders, Mr. Reese said, \u201cYou could really tell Andy was such a caring person, and really sweet and genuine \u2014 a nice Midwest boy living in the city.\u201d", "A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, Mr. Reese has a law degree from Columbia and a master\u2019s degree in cosmetics, fragrance marketing and management from the Fashion Institute of Technology. He is now a vice president for strategic initiatives at the Est\u00e9e Lauder Companies.", "\u201cI really was taken by his honesty and his authenticity, and his really beautiful blue eyes,\u201d added Mr. Reese, who is originally from New York.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "\u201cWe hit it off right from the start,\u201d said Mr. Shoulders, who is the director of the Moschino store in New York, and graduated with honors from Indiana University.", "Both said they felt a chemistry emerge between them on their first date, which ended with a first kiss (\u201cOn the street, before we said goodbye,\u201d Mr. Reese said).", "Mr. Shoulders said it was \u201cthe best first date I\u2019d ever had,\u201d and that, a few months later, the two were in love.", "\u201cI remember saying \u2018I love you\u2019 for the first time, at his 35th birthday,\u201d Mr. Shoulders said. \u201cHe brought me a drink and I was, \u201cThanks! I love you!\u201d", "Of that moment, Mr. Reese added, \u201cHe stopped and put his hand over his mouth. He just kind of blurted it out, in front of a group of people.\u201d", "But before the night was over, Mr. Reese had reciprocated.", "\u201cIt was definitely new for me \u2014 I\u2019d only felt that feeling once before,\u201d Mr. Reese said. \u201cWhen we would kiss, I just felt completely enveloped by him, and that was the sign for me. It was a feeling that was just all encompassing.\u201d", "Nine years after their first date, the two became engaged in February 2019. \u201cAndy proposed to me on a corner of 15th and 10th avenue,\u201d Mr. Reese said. \u201cI was shocked. I had always thought I would be the one to propose, but he\u2019s the one who has been taking the leaps forward and dragging me across the line.\u201d", "The couple were married Nov. 14 in their apartment in Manhattan, with Jason Mitchell Kahn, a Universal Life minister, officiating. On Oct. 30, the couple had a wedding celebration at the Bowery Hotel in New York. Federal District Court Judge Richard L. Young of Indiana, an uncle of Mr. Shoulders\u2019s, led the couple in reciting their vows. About 100 people, all vaccinated against the coronavirus, attended. On Dec. 28, they will have a second celebration in Mr. Shoulders\u2019s hometown, Evansville, Ind., also with about 100 guests.", "After the date that could have been their last, Mr. Shoulders told friends at the birthday party that his dinner with \u201ca really great guy\u201d had come to a perplexing conclusion. So when Mr. Reese unexpectedly appeared, Mr. Shoulders was thrilled.", "\u201cIt was the perfect movie moment,\u201d Mr. Shoulders said. \u201cSmile on my face. \u2018Oh! He came! So it must not have been me!\u201d"]
